articles.headline: In Private Remarks to Arab Americans, Biden Aide Expresses Regrets on Gaza
articles.snippet: In a closed-door meeting, the aide offered some of the administration’s clearest notes of contrition for its response to the Gaza war, a sign of rising Democratic pressure on President Biden.
articles.abstract: In a closed-door meeting, the aide offered some of the administration’s clearest notes of contrition for its response to the Gaza war, a sign of rising Democratic pressure on President Biden.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a closed-door meeting with Arab American leaders in Michigan this week, one of President Biden’s top foreign policy aides acknowledged mistakes in the administration’s response to the war in Gaza, saying he did not have “any confidence” that Israel’s government was willing to take “meaningful steps” toward Palestinian statehood.
articles.byline: By Reid J. Epstein and Erica L. Green

articles.headline: Netanyahu Orders Evacuation Plan for City Where a Million Gazans Shelter
articles.snippet: Many civilians in Rafah are sheltering in rickety tents made of plastic and wood and say there is nowhere left in Gaza to avoid Israeli shelling.
articles.abstract: Many civilians in Rafah are sheltering in rickety tents made of plastic and wood and say there is nowhere left in Gaza to avoid Israeli shelling.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has ordered the Israeli military to draw up plans to evacuate Rafah, a Gazan city packed with more than a million people, in advance of an expected ground offensive that has set off international alarm.
articles.byline: By Aaron Boxerman, Iyad Abuheweila, Hiba Yazbek and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: For Gen Z, an Age-Old Question: Who Pays for Dates?
articles.snippet: Young people tend to lean more liberal on a range of issues pertaining to relationship norms. But when it comes to dating, the idea that men should pay still prevails in heterosexual courtship.
articles.abstract: Young people tend to lean more liberal on a range of issues pertaining to relationship norms. But when it comes to dating, the idea that men should pay still prevails in heterosexual courtship.
articles.lead_paragraph: During a recent dinner at a cozy bar in Upper Manhattan, I was confronted with an age-old question about gender norms. Over bowls of ramen and sips of gin cocktails, my date and I got into a debate: Who should pay for dates?

articles.headline: Shocking Opposition Victory Throws Pakistan Into Chaos
articles.snippet: The party of Imran Khan, the jailed former prime minister, took the most seats, humiliating the country’s military rulers and creating a political crisis.
articles.abstract: The party of Imran Khan, the jailed former prime minister, took the most seats, humiliating the country’s military rulers and creating a political crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: The party of the imprisoned former prime minister of Pakistan, Imran Khan, won the most seats in parliamentary elections this week, delivering a strong rebuke to the country’s powerful generals and throwing the political system into chaos.

articles.headline: U.N. Agency in Gaza Fought Hamas Infiltration; Not Hard Enough, Israel Says
articles.snippet: The main U.N. agency in Gaza said it has long investigated claims of links, firing several employees over the years. Israel says it is a compromised organization too weak to protect itself.
articles.abstract: The main U.N. agency in Gaza said it has long investigated claims of links, firing several employees over the years. Israel says it is a compromised organization too weak to protect itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the United Nations launched an investigation a decade ago into whether a handful of its employees in Gaza were members of Hamas, it was not long before a senior U.N. legal officer in the territory started receiving death threats.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Ronen Bergman

articles.headline: Why the Age Issue Is Hurting Biden So Much More Than Trump
articles.snippet: Both Donald J. Trump and President Biden are over 75. But voters are much less likely to worry that Mr. Trump is too old to serve.
articles.abstract: Both Donald J. Trump and President Biden are over 75. But voters are much less likely to worry that Mr. Trump is too old to serve.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump has praised Hungary’s prime minister, Viktor Orban, for his leadership of Turkey, and confused Nikki Haley with Nancy Pelosi. President Biden has named dead former European leaders when describing his contemporary peers, and referred to Egypt as Mexico.

articles.headline: ‘It Is Suffocating’: A Top Liberal University Is Under Attack in India
articles.snippet: A campaign to make the country an explicitly Hindu nation has had a chilling effect on left-leaning and secular institutions like Jawaharlal Nehru University.
articles.abstract: A campaign to make the country an explicitly Hindu nation has had a chilling effect on left-leaning and secular institutions like Jawaharlal Nehru University.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jawaharlal Nehru University, named for India’s first prime minister, is one of the country’s premier liberal institutions, a hothouse of strong opinions and left-leaning values whose graduates populate the upper echelons of academia and government.

articles.headline: Lost at Parkland: ‘Peter Was Always My Translator’
articles.snippet: For one family, grieving the child they lost in the Parkland, Fla., school shooting is complicated by differences in language and culture.
articles.abstract: For one family, grieving the child they lost in the Parkland, Fla., school shooting is complicated by differences in language and culture.
articles.lead_paragraph: Linda Zhang wandered into her son’s room and sat for a while. She visits there from time to time, after her husband has gone to work at the restaurant and their other kids have gone to school.

articles.headline: ‘This Is Where I Want to Be’
articles.snippet: Kibbutz Kfar Azza was evacuated after more than 60 residents were murdered and at least 18 were kidnapped on Oct. 7. But one family has returned.
articles.abstract: Kibbutz Kfar Azza was evacuated after more than 60 residents were murdered and at least 18 were kidnapped on Oct. 7. But one family has returned.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Ayelet Khon moved back to the Kfar Azza kibbutz with her husband two months after the brutal Hamas-led attack of Oct. 7, the first thing she did was hang a string of rainbow-colored lights up on the front patio.

articles.headline: What Happens When TikTok Is Your Marketing Department
articles.snippet: The Pink Stuff, a home cleaning paste, went from total obscurity to viral sensation — and Walmart staple — thanks to one “cleanfluencer” and her legion of fans.
articles.abstract: The Pink Stuff, a home cleaning paste, went from total obscurity to viral sensation — and Walmart staple — thanks to one “cleanfluencer” and her legion of fans.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2018, The Pink Stuff was little more than a home cleaning product with a cute name. “The miracle cleaning paste,” as it said on every container, was sold by just two retail chains in Britain. At a factory near Birmingham, The Pink Stuff line operated for about two hours every month. That was plenty.

articles.headline: Hate Valentine’s Day? There’s a Market for You, Too.
articles.snippet: Single, anti-consumerist or just not a romantic? From petty heartbreak healers to anti-Valentine’s Day parties, groups are finding ways to resonate with naysayers.
articles.abstract: Single, anti-consumerist or just not a romantic? From petty heartbreak healers to anti-Valentine’s Day parties, groups are finding ways to resonate with naysayers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lilly Calman is not in the mood this Valentine’s Day for the flowers, chocolates or a romantic dinner for two, especially after a recent breakup.

articles.headline: Favoring Foes Over Friends, Trump Threatens to Upend International Order
articles.snippet: Former President Donald J. Trump suggested that he would incite Russia to attack “delinquent” U.S. allies, foreshadowing potentially far-reaching changes in the world order if he wins the White House again.
articles.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump suggested that he would incite Russia to attack “delinquent” U.S. allies, foreshadowing potentially far-reaching changes in the world order if he wins the White House again.
articles.lead_paragraph: Soon after former President Donald J. Trump took office, his staff explained how NATO’s mutual defense obligations worked.

articles.headline: An Outburst by Trump on NATO May Push Europe to Go It Alone
articles.snippet: Many were alarmed by comments that he would “encourage” Russia to attack U.S. allies that didn’t spend enough on their militaries, but European leaders were already pondering the prospect of an alliance without the United States.
articles.abstract: Many were alarmed by comments that he would “encourage” Russia to attack U.S. allies that didn’t spend enough on their militaries, but European leaders were already pondering the prospect of an alliance without the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: Long before Donald J. Trump threatened over the weekend that he was willing to let Russia “do whatever the hell they want” against NATO allies that do not contribute sufficiently to collective defense, European leaders were quietly discussing how they might prepare for a world in which America removes itself as the centerpiece of the 75-year-old alliance.

articles.headline: Israel Says It Will Protect Civilians in a Gazan City It Is Determined to Invade
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel would invade refugee-packed Rafah, but was drafting a plan to help people get out of harm’s way.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel would invade refugee-packed Rafah, but was drafting a plan to help people get out of harm’s way.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, brushing aside a chorus of international condemnation, said Sunday that a ground invasion of the southern Gazan city of Rafah would move forward as soon as Israel completed plans for the more than a million people sheltering there to be allowed to move to safety.
articles.byline: By Isabel Kershner, Andrés R. Martínez and Sarah Maslin Nir

articles.headline: How China Built BYD, Its Tesla Killer
articles.snippet: The leading Chinese electric vehicle company, with origins as a battery maker, has posted two years of million-car growth in sales.
articles.abstract: The leading Chinese electric vehicle company, with origins as a battery maker, has posted two years of million-car growth in sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: China’s BYD was a battery manufacturer trying its hand at building cars when it showed off its newest model in 2007. American executives at the Guangzhou auto show gaped at the car’s uneven purple paint job and the poor fit of its doors.

articles.headline: It’s Mardi Gras. Welcome to The King Cake Drive-Thru.
articles.snippet: A tire shop parking lot has become a popular destination for those craving the beloved treat. The only problem: Which variety to choose?
articles.abstract: A tire shop parking lot has become a popular destination for those craving the beloved treat. The only problem: Which variety to choose?
articles.lead_paragraph: Of course Mardi Gras is about boundless revelry: the weeks of balls and the parades that shower the streets of New Orleans with beads. But beneath all that, it is also a period of metamorphosis.

articles.headline: Leaving Las Vegas to High Rollers, Some 49ers Fans Chose Reno
articles.snippet: With sports betting illegal in California and daunting prices in the Super Bowl host city, some San Francisco fans embraced an alternative.
articles.abstract: With sports betting illegal in California and daunting prices in the Super Bowl host city, some San Francisco fans embraced an alternative.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every Super Bowl Sunday, thousands of gamblers head to the Grand Sierra Resort and Casino, the largest of its kind in northern Nevada, to bet on the big game and party with fellow football fans. High rollers dine on all-you-can-eat buffets and the champagne flows in V.I.P. rooms throughout the massive complex. Long lines snake out of the William Hill Sportsbook just off the casino floor.
